content: this legal case involves a coownership property specifically an apartment building located in s the coowners of the apartment are heirs bn with each having a 13 share the petitioner claims that the other party made illegal investments without consent causing a delay in the proceedings the court examined documentation from the land registry inheritance resolution and expert opinions an expert determined the value of the property with each party entitled to a share the petitioner raised objections to the experts opinion and suggested either having the expert explain their findings orally or conducting a new examination with another expert another expert confirmed the previous findings but updated the estimates due to changes in the housing price index the court rejected one partys request for additional comments on the evidence and considered physically dividing the property but determined it would be too costly as a result the court decided to sell the property through a public auction and distribute the proceeds among the parties based on their ownership shares the final resolution will determine the method of division and will be carried out according to the rules of the enforcement act
